intro: Matricaria vulgaris, commonly known as the common chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, silvery-green leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer and early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Matricaria vulgaris is widely cultivated for its calming properties and is used in herbal teas and traditional medicine.
